{{Infobox album | Name = Years | Type = studio | Artist = [[Ohad Benchetrit|Years]] | Cover = yearsalbum.jpg | Released = May 5, 2009 | Recorded = 2008 | Genre = [[Instrumental]], [[Post-Rock]] | Length = | Label = [[Arts & Crafts (record label)|Arts & Crafts]] | Producer = [[Ohad Benchetrit]] | Last album = | This album = '''Years'''
(2009) | Next album = }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = ''[[Chart (magazine)|Chart]]'' | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}} [http://www.chartattack.com/reviews/69291/years-years ''Chart'' review] | rev2 = [[Drowned in Sound]] | rev2Score = (9/10) [http://drownedinsound.com/releases/14511/reviews/4137366 Drowned in Sound review] | rev3 = ''[[New Musical Express|NME]]'' | rev3Score = (8/10) [http://www.nme.com/reviews/years/10673 ''NME'' review] | rev4 = [[Canuckistan Music]] | rev4Score = (not rated) [http://www.canuckistanmusic.com/index.php?maid=218 Canuckistan Music review] }} '''''Years''''' is the debut solo album by Years, a solo project by [[Ohad Benchetrit]] of [[Do Make Say Think]] and [[Broken Social Scene]]. ''Years'' was born from the wealth of music that Benchetrit had been gathering, but did not belong with his other projects. ''"I basically just wanted to use all of this material that I'd compiled on my hard drive,"'' he says, ''"songs that got started and never finished, or that were parts of other projects and never really got off the ground. So I started trying to finish that [unfinished] record. But in the process, I kept replacing the older songs, one song at a time. About a year later, I'd replaced them all. Years was the album I was left with."''[http://www.chartattack.com/news/69444/years-exorcise-skeletons "Years Exorcise Skeletons"]. ''[[Chart (magazine)|Chart]]'', May 7, 2009. ''Years'' has been described as "the best parts of [[Bell Orchestre]], [[I Am Robot And Proud]] and [[The Hylozoists]], and combines them into a sweeping flurry of instruments"[http://www.chartattack.com/reviews/69291/years-years Album Review: Years]. ''[[Chart (magazine)|Chart]]'', May 5, 2009. ''Years'' was recently named "record of the year" by [[Jude Rogers]] of ''[[The Guardian]]'', and was described as "quite simply a triumph" by Paul Brown of [[Drowned in Sound]].[http://drownedinsound.com/releases/14511/reviews/4137366 Album Review: Years]. ''[[Drowned in Sound]]'', July 14, 2009. ==Guest appearances== Performers on the album include fellow [[Do Make Say Think]] members [[Justin Small]], and Dave Mitchell, as well as frequent [[Broken Social Scene]] contributors [[Evan Cranley]] and [[Julie Penner]]. ==Track listing== # "Kids Toy Love Affair" # "Don't Let The Blind Go Deaf" # "Are You Unloved?" # "Hey Cancer... Fuck You!" # "Binary Blues" # "A Thousand Times A Day (Someone Is Flying)" # "The Assassination of Dow Jones" # "[[Lasantha Wickrematunge]]" # "September 5. October 21. 2007." # "The Fall Of Winter" # "The Major Lift" # "44" ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Years}} [[Category:2009 albums]] [[Category:Arts & Crafts (record label) albums]]
